intro: Allium azutavicum, commonly known as the Aztec garlic or Aztec leek, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous stem and grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of white to pale purple flowers that bloom in summer. It is often cultivated for its culinary and medicinal properties. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Allium genus.
